text: The counties of Croatia () are the first-level administrative divisions of the Republic of Croatia.The Constitution of the Republic of Croatia (consolidated text) - Croatian Parliament .Retrieved 5 October 2016. Croatia is divided into 20 counties and the capital city of Zagreb, which is both a county and a city. It is separate from Zagreb County. The counties are divided into 128 cities and 428 municipalities. The counties are governed by county assemblies (). Members of the county assembly are elected for a four-year term. ==List of counties== Counties of Croatia as defined in 2006 County Seat Area Population (2011) GDP per capita (2013) Arms Geographic coordinates Bjelovar-Bilogora Bjelovar style="text-align:right" Brod-Posavina Slavonski Brod style="text- align:right" Dubrovnik-Neretva Dubrovnik style="text-align:right" Istria Pazin style="text-align:right" Karlovac Karlovac style="text-align:right" Koprivnica-Križevci Koprivnica style="text-align:right" Krapina-Zagorje Krapina style="text-align:right" Lika-Senj Gospić style="text-align:right" Međimurje CČakovecČakovec 0,730 113,804 08481€8,481 Osijek-Baranja Osijek style="text-align:right" Požega-Slavonia Požega style="text-align:right" Primorje-Gorski Kotar Rijeka style="text-align:right" SŠibenikŠibenik-Knin SŠibenikŠibenik style="text-align:right" Sisak-Moslavina Sisak style="text- align:right" Split-Dalmatia Split style="text-align:right" Varaždin Varaždin style="text-align:right" Virovitica-Podravina Virovitica style="text- align:right" Vukovar-Srijem Vukovar style="text-align:right" Zadar Zadar style="text-align:right" Zagreb County Zagreb style="text-align:right" Zagreb, the city ofCity of Zagreb Zagreb 0,641 790,017 18132€18,132 ==References==
